wikipedia_page.main:
Mark Flanagan (born in Liverpool) is a blues guitarist who plays with Jools Holland's band, The Rhythm and Blues Orchestra. He also fronts the trio "Flanagan", which currently includes himself, Adam Double and George Double. He is also fronting the band The Fields.
He is also a frequent session musician for live television appearances, having worked with Chaka Khan, Paul Weller, Barry White, Eric Clapton and George Harrison.

response: * Flanagan, a band fronted by Mark Flanagan (musician)
Delphi Newman and guitarist Paul Greendale formed the band World Without Tigers in 1998. In 2002, she sang on Mark Flanagan's album The Chosen Few.

* Mark Flanagan (communications), former head of strategic communications at 10 Downing Street, now a partner at Portland Communications

* Mark Flanagan (rugby union) (born 1989), Irish rugby union player
* Mark Flanagan, owner of the Largo nightclub in Los Angeles
